node.title: NSW man charged with using social media to advocate violence against politicians
node.description: The ABC understands the Prime Minister Scott Morrison and Victorian Premier Dan Andrews were among those targeted by 37-year-old farmhand Wade Homewood.
node.content: ["A NSW man has been charged with using social media platforms\u00a0to\u00a0advocate\u00a0acts of terrorism and violence against prominent Australian politicians.", "It's alleged Wade Homewood, 37, was a prolific user of social media and\u00a0posted a large volume of extremist content,\u00a0urging violence against people he singled out for their race, occupation or political viewpoints.", "The ABC understands that the Prime Minister,\u00a0Scott Morrison, and Victorian Premier, Dan Andrews,\u00a0were among those targeted.", "The NSW Police Joint Counter Terrorism team began investigating the farmhand\u00a0in September after identifying a number of potentially criminal posts.", "This week, police searched a home in Tamworth, where Mr Homewood lives with his parents, as well as two semi-rural blocks in the area, seizing a number of electronic devices and a collection of hand-written and printed material.", "Yesterday, officers arrested Mr Homewood and charged him with one count of urging violence against members or groups and one count of advocating terrorism", "Each count carries a maximum penalty of five years in prison.", "He appeared at Tamworth Local Court today, where he was refused bail.", "Australian Federal Police Assistant Commissioner Scott Lee said police acted due to concern that the man's alleged online activity could\u00a0incite\u00a0others to commit acts of violence.", "\"The man's quantity of messages on online forums was of similar concern to the actual content of the message, resulting in the very real fear that it would inspire someone to commit a violent or terrorist act,\" he said.", "The man\u00a0will reappear in Parramatta Local Court on December 10."]
